Version 2.0.74 - Prevent lesson_location Backward in DB

Bug Fixes

  • Fix content loading at current slide instead of furthest on page refresh
  • lesson_location in DB now always holds the furthest slide reached, never goes backward
  • Content resumes at furthest position on every page load (works from first visit)

Changes

  • LMSSetValue interceptor writes max(value, furthestSlide) for lesson_location to DB
  • Position bar still tracks actual current position (uses original value for tracking)
  • Works for both SCORM 1.2 (cmi.core.lesson_location) and SCORM 2004 (cmi.location)
  • Also persist furthestSlide in localStorage as fallback for cross-tab resume (v2.0.73)

Previous Versions

  • v2.0.73: Persist furthestSlide in localStorage for cross-tab/refresh resume
  • v2.0.72: Score-based resume correction via LMSInitialize wrap and initial retry
  • v2.0.71: Faster initial progress: 200ms retry instead of fixed 1000ms timeout
